skillTree.localised_description: Enables the Terrorgheist Mount

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

skillTree.localised_description: When a Mourngul Lord gathers his fleet, the hideous and stinking corpses of the most feared creatures of the sea swim along their ships

effects.description:
Leadership +4% for all Monster units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership +8% for all Monster units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Whereby the power of death itself is used to hold back the physical world.
It's been a long, hard voyage to get to this point, but now trust and loyalty - so difficult to engender among freebooters - is firmly established between Lord and admiral.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The mere vision of the ragged sails and worn ships of a Mourngul Lord´s fleet on the horizon is more than enough for entire cities to fall into a blind state of panic

effects.description:
Income from all enemy buildings: -5%
	(local enemy province)

skillTree.localised_description: The thirst of this vampire is unquencheable and he will never stop pursuing his prey
On land and sea, Strigoi will attract and give unlife and strength to the most reviled creatures of the world, those that devour the flesh of mortals until they themselves are corrupted by Dark Magic

effects.description:
Weapon Strength: +4% for Mournguls units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +8% for Mournguls units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Other Vampire Captains search corpses of the greatest see monsters to reanimate and use them. An Strigoi hunts the living ones and kills them himself

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +2 for Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
"See my coat of crimson armour? It is strengthened by thine blood and fear."
"Look into mine eyes, mortal; what glories do you see?"
The sword-strikes of mortal man are but clumsy, childish lunges before the preternatural speed of a Vampire.
Strike hard, strike true.
The strength of this Vampire to endure the centuries is beyond compare.
To look upon this Undead Lord is to witness true and absolute horror!

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: The supernatural solution is often the best; weapons materialise before the caster's allies, allowing them to slice through flesh, soul, and consciousness.

skillTree.localised_description: "Listen very carefully, me hearties, I shall say this only once… Quiet! Stromfels' stinkin' breath!"
The once-men of the Undead legions march ever onwards, according to the will of their binder.

skillTree.localised_description: "Now listen up an' listen good… here be the plan…"
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
They could not break free, even if they wanted to.
Cursed to haunt the waves forever, never finding rest or solace.
If it's not tacked down, this one'll 'ave it and kill anyone who gets in their way.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: "You'll never find such a crew - villainous scum, the lot of 'em. I certainly wouldn't want to be facing 'em in the thick of battle!"

skillTree.localised_description: There's a time in every sailor's, er, life when the black flag seems like the best, if not the only option.

Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: A simple glamour can disguise a monstrous Vampire or Liche, so they may then charm and beguile the local populace.
Such things keep the eternal players' of this world alive.
Take care of your ship and she will have a care for your wellbeing in return.
Beware those who sail under the black flag - they give no quarter and never, ever give up the chase.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Beautiful and innocent it may be, but all will be consumed by fire in the end. It is written.

effects.description: Gain loyalty from razing settlements and winning siege battles
Immediately causes wall breaches when besieging
Brute: Extra loyalty gained following a battle

	(enemy armies in local region)

effects.description: Gain loyalty from sacking and raiding

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Killing is at the forefront of this one's mind. Hopefully, they also know how to run a ship.
